newsitem.title: UK: NatWest shaken by Barclays results.
newsitem.headline: NatWest shaken by Barclays results.

text.p: National Westminster Bank shares extended their early losses at midday on Tuesday as a tumble in Barclays shares on disappointing profits cast a shadow over NatWest's results next week, dealers and analyst said.
With Barclays down 54-1/2p at 11.45 stg by 1315 GMT in volume of 17.2 million shares, NatWest was down 19p at 815-1/2 in volume of 3.4 million.

Analysts pointed out that NatWest shares had risen sharply since the start of the year on the back of a run of positive analyst comments. The stock reached a peak of 845p on February 10, up some 23 percent since the end of 1996.

"NatWest is a stock where there could be concern that people got a bit too exuberant," said John Leonard, analyst at Salomon Brothers, "and the fact that Barclays came up a bit short is making people think about next week's results."
The shortfall in Barclays profits was due at least partly to a fall in profits at its investment banking arm -- an area where NatWest has expanded with a servies of major acquisitions.
